subject: Sports Medicine
Olympic Games
lead_paragraph: The former world and Olympic champion hurdler Liu Xiang had successful surgery for a foot injury that forced him to withdraw at the starting line during the Beijing Olympics. Dr. Tom Clanton said Liu, 25, had four small pieces of bone removed from the Achilles’ tendon in his right foot in a one-hour operation at Memorial Hermann-Texas Medical Center in Houston.
